text: Marek Jakóbczak (1970 - 27 June 2014) was a Polish footballer. He graduated from a small club in Warsaw Pharmacy Tarchomin. He played with the teams Polonia Warsaw, Radomiak Radom, Steel Steel Will, Petrochemical Plock, GKS Belchatow-ie, Jagiellonia Bialystok, Silesia, Wroclaw and Israeli Hapoel Beit She'an. He had played 49 matches in the league and scored 9 goals. Jakóbczak died in Warsaw, Poland from lung cancer, aged 44. ==References== Category:1970 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Poland Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Polish footballers Category:Sportspeople from Warsaw
title: Marek Jakóbczak
